column5: Got these at an estate sale along with a pile of other spoons. From the look of the other spoons I would guess they are about 20 years old?  	I've never fished them, are they any good, and if they are when would you use them?
http://www.canadianwiggler.com/cisco It's hard to judge the thickness of the metal and so the weight, bu it looks like a dipsy or downrigger lure?
Looks like a spoon for vertical or ice fishing, can you slip a double in those side holes ?
Cisco Spoon was a friend of mine!!!!

These lures are about 5 inches. The rest of the collection looked to be for larger trout or pike. Apparently there is a whole Cisco product line and they are/were made in Canada. http://www.canadianwiggler.com/cisco  	How do you fish them?
Yes it does. That may have gone over some Gen Xers and Millennials heads you old time RockÂ n' Rolla'. He was a friend of mine too, da dada do dada do.
Funny Stuff--good to learn you haven't lost your edge  Tight Lines Man  Paul
